idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: United States Telephone Area Code Boundaries is a polygon theme representing the telephone area codes for the United States. They are also known as Numbering Plan Areas (NPA). The Numbering Plan Areas reflect current and accurate boundary changes both where new NPAs split from existing NPAs and where new NPAs overlay existing NPAs.
descript.purpose: U.S. Telephone Area Code Boundaries provides the telephone area codes of the United States for use in telecommunications analysis.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

citeinfo.title: United States Telephone Area Code Boundaries, 2012

cntinfo.cntinst:

For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the telephone area codes within the United States. Note: The overlay NPAs are represented as one polygon one top of another (each or part of each polygon occupies the same location).

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The three-digit telephone area code (Numbering Plan Area (NPA) code).
The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the telephone area code is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri software.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the Esri Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: TomTom Telecommunication Suite; TomTom MultiNet Administrative Areas, 2012

serinfo.sername: TomTom Telecommunication Suite; TomTom MultiNet North America

srcinfo.srccitea: TomTom Telecommunication Suite v. 2011.12 and MultiNet Administrative Areas v. 2011.12

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied the Area Code (NPA) Boundaries data set from TomTom Telecommunication Suite v. 2011.12. Projected the data set to World Geodetic System of 1984 (WGS 1984). Created the STATE field via the geoprocessing tool Identity with Data & Maps 2012 U.S. States. Added field SQMI and calculated its values. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
procstep.srcused: TomTom Telecommunication Suite v. 2011.12 and MultiNet Administrative Areas v. 2011.12

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is difficult to determine since the boundaries may follow state, county, city, or other political boundaries. Still other times they may follow streets or other linear features in the database. Since these features are derived from different sources, it is not possible to give a single overall figure for horizontal accuracy.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
